data.title: Trying to install Atom Editor
data.body:
Hello boys (and girls)
I am trying to install the awesome Atom editor on my Arch Linux system but something is going wrong. 
I am trying to execute atom/script/build to build the dependencies and modules using this command:

--> ./script/build 
Node: v0.12.4
npm: v2.5.1
Installing build modules...
Installing apm...
/home/stefanozzz123/.sources/atom/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/bin/apm: line 28: /home/stefanozzz123/.sources/atom/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/bin/node: No such file or directory

I checked everything as the Build markdown file says. Thanks :)

data.title: Freeze when changing file encoding
data.body:
I opened a subtitle file with Turkish (Windows 1254) encoding in Atom, and it opened it as UTF-8 by default.

Then I tried changing the encoding to Turkish (Windows 1254), but the editor froze and even displayed a dialog saying that it's not responding. I pressed on "Keep waiting" and after a while the file was re-loaded with my selected encoding.

It's very very slow... not even usable. 

Atom 1.0.0
Machine: Intel i7 4790K with 16GB RAM.
OS: Mac OS X 10.10.3

Sample file to reproduce:
http://www.filedropper.com/dannycollins2015720pweb-dldd51h264-playnow

data.title: I can't set the editor's default encoding format
data.body: Atom is very good, but with sublime does have a fatal problem: coding issues. I can't to save file by default for Unix/utf-8, even if is to set the default utf-8 format, but with other editor such as notepad + + is open you will find that the coding format DOS/ANSI!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Can't enter a " ] " --- Alt Gr + " ) " shortcut
data.body:
**Atom 1.0.0, Windows 8.1 64bit**

Hello,
I can't enter a **]** in any file (**Alt Gr + )** ), it results in a code "compression", like this :
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11824581/8393057/c3cd2efc-1cfe-11e5-9c01-cac7d4a0b20a.png)
This is probably because of a shortcut (I didn't change shortcuts).
AZERTY / QWERTY mode doesn't affect the problem.

data.title: Atom crashes when an open project folder disappears
data.body:
I have a Rails project hosted on a local "server" in my office.  The "server" happens to be a laptop, so if/when it goes to sleep, the file share disappears from my development machine.  When I remount the share, the tree-view sidebar in Atom shows only the top project folder, but not the sub files/folders.  When I click the disclosure button to collapse the tree, and then click it again to expand, the file structure reappears for a split second, then the main Atom window turns blank white and I get this error panel:

![screen shot 2015-06-27 at 10 21 23 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/747085/8395008/0cab4b74-1d1b-11e5-8c1b-6171f8faed0a.png)

Clicking on `Reload`, or `Keep It Open` usually results in the editor being unstable, or crashing completely.

data.title: Atom does not behave like a Windows application
data.body:
Atom feels like a very alien program when running on Windows. Its behaviour does not match users' expectations.

Installation problems:
- Not present in Start menu at all (can't press start, type "atom" to run)
- Shortcut installed only on user's desktop (no option given to not clutter the desktop)
- No proper way to launch if the desktop shortcut pointing to `atom\update.exe --processStart atom.exe` is removed
- No proper way to find the application for Explorer's Open with... functionality
  - navigation to %LOCALAPPDATA%/Atom difficult to figure out and perform
  - impossible to know what to select once there -> Can't be set as a default text editor
  - related: #7205 

Behaviour:
- Pinning to taskbar does not work like Windows applications work
  - a new icon is produced when Atom is launched from taskbar (related: #7374)
  - update check probably not run in this case either?
- Does not use OS mouse wheel scroll configuration (lines scrolled per wheel turn)

Windows 10 Pro x64 insider preview build 10130

data.title: How can I execute custom javascript code in a find/replace task?
data.body:
Hello,

My issue is quite simple, but I don't know if atom provides a way to achieve what I want.

I have a list of countries in  ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. here is how it looks:

``` json
{
  "name": "Afghanistan",
  "code": "AF",
  "country-code": "004"
}, {
  "name": "land Islands",
  "code": "AX",
  "country-code": "248"
}, {
  "name": "Albania",
  "code": "AL",
  "country-code": "008"
},
```

I want to change all the codes to their lowercase equivalent. I can select them using a simple regex find string `"[A-Z]{2}"` 

Is there any way to apply a `matchingString.toLowerCase()` on every string matched by my regex? Maybe something like `this.toLowerCase();`

Thanks!

data.title: Python version error on Arch despite exporting python=/usr/bin/python2
data.body:
Hi all, I'm failing to build atom v1.0.0 when I [follow the instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md) for Arch. Whether I do:

```
export python=/usr/bin/python2
script/build
```

..or:

```
python=/usr/bin/python2 script/build
```

..the result is the same:

```
Node: v0.12.5
npm: v2.11.3
Installing build modules...
Installing apm...
```

data.title: slow typing,  lag after enter, high CPU usage
data.body:
I have just installed Atom 1.0.0 and it runs very slow. When I type it seems to lag every 5-10 characters for up to 2-3 seconds. The file I opened has around 3500 lines and 180 kB. I have tried using safe mode and disabling spellcheck, but it is still too slow. CPU usage peaks to 80-100% on one core as soon as I start typing.
When I press enter, editor lags for 3 seconds and CPU usage spikes to maybe 80% on one core.

When I open new file with only several lines, it works without the lag.

System info: Linux 3.13.0-40-generic #69-Ubuntu x86_64, Intel(R) Core(TM) i5 CPU M 520  @ 2.40GHz, 6 GB RAM, SSD.

I like this editor and I would like to help to diagnose this problem if someone tells me what to do.

Thank You.

data.title: "Issue has already been reported" is not always true
data.body: I've noticed this recently, and I can't find any related open issues (but forgive me if there is one). Sometimes while I'm developing something brand new on `quantum-shell` I'll run into an `Uncaught TypeError` and Atom will tell me that the issue has already been reported at `sedabull/quantum-shell/issues` and ask me if I would like to view it. This is obviously ridiculous, but not really a major issue. The reason I'm reporting it now is because I recently had a user open an issue (sedabull/quantum-shell#17) that he believed was a repeat, but was in fact completely unrelated to the first two issues he mentioned. I understand this feature is meant to deter many people from reopening the same issue over and over, but as it stands now it may actually deter users from reporting an issue they believe is already being worked on. Let me know if there's anything I can do to help resolve this.

data.title: Hitting Return key twice deletes the text when using Find feature
data.body:
##### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a plain text file containing a lot of content using Atom
2. Hit Command+F key to search for all instances of a particular text
3. Hit Return key once and the app will focus on the first instance of found text
4. Hit Return again and the instance of the text that was found in a previous step will get deleted
##### Expected Result:
- I would expect that hitting Return key would focus on the next instance of found text when using Find feature.  This is how most editors behave.  I am suspecting this to be a bug on the Mac OS X platform as my co-worker that is using Linux does not have the same issue.
##### Actual Result:
- Hitting Return or Enter key delete the first instance of the search text.

data.title: Touch version of Atom for mobile OSes
data.body:
A touch version of atom with builds for jail broken iOS devices and Android devices.

This will probably take a lot of work to get done but would be worth it. Since atom is a web technology based in nature just making it touch capable would be the only thing needed.

This could be done as a separate branch of Atom and also a version that doesn't have as much of the hack ability as the regular version for release on the iOS App Store.

The iOS version would have to support x-callback-urls for compatibility with coding apps that have them like an app called Working Copy which is a great Git client for iOS.
